Package slotmachine.model.slots

Class WheelImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • slotmachine.model.slots.WheelImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Wheel
    public class WheelImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Wheel
    Supporting class used in the Further Programming Assignment

    Each Wheel object represents one of the three wheels of the Slot Machine.

    Each Wheel has 3 visible slots; centre, top and bottom. Each Wheel can be turned, advancing to the next slot, using Wheel.nextSlot()

    The class should have no visible constructor (must be private)

    As well as all the method defined in the Wheel interface the class must provide the following two static methods. 

     public static Wheel createWheel(int wheelNum)
 
     public static List<SlotItem> generateSlots()
    Author:
    YOU!

    • Method Detail

      • createWheel

        public static Wheel createWheel​(int wheelNum)
        Creates a single Wheel with filled with SlotItem in randomised order

        Note: Note the Slot Machine needs 3 distinct wheels.

        Parameters:
        wheelNum - the wheels number (should be 1, 2 or 3 - not validated)
        Returns:
        Wheel with SlotItem in randomised order
        See Also:
        generateSlots()

      • generateSlots

        public static java.util.List<SlotItem> generateSlots()
        Creates a List of SlotItem in randomised order

        The number of each type of SlotItem value should be determined by each value's SlotItem.getCount(). e.g. there should be 2 SlotItem.GOLD in the List

        In the assignment the List will include 100 SlotItem, but this number must be purely based on each values SlotItem.getCount()

        This methods will be used to aid testing/marking and should be used in the creating of your wheels.

        Returns:
        a randomised List of SlotItem

      • nextSlot

        public Wheel nextSlot()
        Description copied from interface: Wheel
        This method turns the Wheel one slot.

        A turn is defined a advancing the slots of a wheel one position. An new (unseen) slot item will appear as the top of the wheel. The slot previously at the top moves to the centre and the previous centre slot moves to the bottom. The previous bottom slot is not longer visible.

        Specified by:
        nextSlot in interface Wheel
        Returns:
        the same wheel object (with its state updated).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Wheel
        Returns a String representing the Wheel in format shown in the two examples below and seen in the output trace. 
         Wheel #1: 3          / 5          / Silver Bar
 
         Wheel #3: Berry      / 3          / 3
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Wheel
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing the Wheel
